website_summaries.verdict: A popular all-in-one solution that is lightweight and easy for the amateur to use. The best bargain deal out there.
pros: Great for smaller jobs like furniture and trim
Kit includes compressor, sprayer and hose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome time saver
customer_reviews.text: I smoked through staining my fence. Made life so much easier and took little time to get the hang of it. As with a lot of projects most work is in the prep work. Pressure washed first, 10+ years of paint, then stained. Great product and highly recommend for fence staining.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye engineer

customer_reviews.title: Model 0518050 NOT FOR LATEX PAINT
customer_reviews.text: Not For Latex Paint. I order d this based on the product description."Double Duty" - what ever that means. I did some further research because of low reviews and determined this mode is not suitable for Latex Paint. I tried to cancel, but it was too late. The production description should state NOT FOR LATEX PAINT. That would save a lot of bad review, returns, dissatisfied customers, wasted time and effort. Model 0518050 Only!
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo257

customer_reviews.title: I just used this yesterday it was fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this yesterday it was fantastic!!!! I painted 28 shutters with slats with ease! Each one took about 2min a piece! This is worth every penny I paid for it. The last time I painted these shutters it took 2 days with a paint brush. It was my first time using a sprayer and only wish that I had discovered it sooner. I thought it would be complicated because I am female and not familiar with thing like that. I used SW latex with primer paint and put a little water to thin. Clean up was easy just follow directions but do clean it good so it won't clog. Hopes this helps!!!!
customer_reviews.author: winmille19

customer_reviews.title: Benjamin Moore Advance
customer_reviews.text: Since there were no reviews for this sprayer used with Benjamin Moore Advance paint on cabinets, I thought I'd post my experience. Searched for a while to see if anyone had experience with HVLP's and BM Advance, and eventually stumbled on some advice to thin the paint 10% with distilled water. Started with 5% and it came out pretty spotty and orange-peely. The next coat I went to 10% and it sprays like a dream. Got the perfect professional looking result as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: No power, won't spray latex even way thinned, almost doesn't spray thinned alkyd enamel
customer_reviews.text: Really did not like this sprayer. I bought it based on other people saying it had worked for paints not just stains and light finishes but it really does not. I tried to spray latex with it and even thinned a ton it wouldn't spray much, just fits and spurts. Then I tried thinned alkyd enamel and had to put so much spirits in that it was hard to even keep the thinned paint mixture consistent. It finally sprayed okay with that, but it was waaaaaaay thinned and just a huge pain. Do yourself a favor and buy a more powerful sprayer. This is just a frustration. The other sprayer I have now is so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good spray gun. I'm a former body man that knows a thing or two about spray guns and paint. It's very difficult to control the material (outdoor stain) and the gun spit when I released the trigger at the end of one pass and pulled it again for the next pass. It would be better if you never released the trigger. The pattern is inconsistent at best with too much material at the top and bottom of the spray pattern. The best thing about it was that it is easy to clean so I can get it back in the box to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mantone

customer_reviews.title: Junk for latex
customer_reviews.text: Junk. I’m a professional contractor, have sprayed plenty. Bought this based on reviews to do smaller jobs like cabinets and furniture, thinned to recommendation twice and results are blotchy and horrific. Now a lot of sanding ahead and burned an $80 gallon of paint.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: This review might save you some money....
customer_reviews.text: After two of these started leaking just outside of the warranty I'm going to attempt to save others from wasting their money. I was scolded by customer service for using lacquer in this sprayer so I'm including a picture from page 5 of the owners manual that specifically lists lacquer as one of the materials to consider using. I have nothing else to add to influence other potential buyers of Wagner products, but I will not ever buy a Wagner branded product again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fletchall

customer_reviews.title: It delivers a great control spray you can adjust
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive Wagner electrical paint gun !!!! I ordered this product because , I started to paint my Kitchen cabinet's .It delivers a great control spray you can adjust .The Quality of work it delivers is professional .
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine last june and used it for a hour..today i took it out and was using it to paint a fence panel,,,it sprayed a gallon of paint great,,then i turned it back on for a few minutes and it just cut off.......smells like motor is burnt,,,im asssumming it has a 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.author: csmith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to thin
customer_reviews.text: Used this hvlp to spray kitchen cabinets. Easy to thin, Cleans easily, never clogged or spattered as long as you got the thickness/viscosity as recommended. Left a much nicer finish than a brush or roller (I tried them also). Sprayed 10-15 doors at a time, probably took a few minutes. Used Insl-x cabinet coat that was tinted slightly. Thinned with water which worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for house projects
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this over the weekend, Never liked these little house sprayers because if you tilt it the wrong way it stops suction of the paint, This style is a little different, I painted 100' of 6' stockade fence with no problem, give it 3 coats overall..... Very impressed, cleaning is simple just make sure you do a good job at it. Would recommend it for around the house projects. 3-1-2016 Painted a pergola and re-painted my deck, very impressed.. Love it !
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage unless you are spraying water.
customer_reviews.text: This thing cant seem to push out any paint, it does ok with water or maybe stain but anything thicker than that and it just speckles fat blobs of paint onto whatever you are painting. Imagine sucking paint into a stray and blowing it at a wall, that is how this item works.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Painted the side of my house with Behr exterior primer + paint combination paint (not diluted). Took about 4 hours to get through 2 gallons of paint, and it feels like one or both of my arms might fall off from holding the sprayer. The side of the house was brown, now white, and coverage was pretty good overall. I give it 4 stars because I wish the flow were faster - nobody wants to be holding one of these things out in front of them for 4 hours. Faster flow rate would have cut that time down dramatically, but it is what it is. Clean up wasn't so bad in a utility sink with a pipe cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Tadpole

customer_reviews.title: Works great and excellent spray control
customer_reviews.text: Works great it’s my second sprayer of this type . This one has much better pattern control which makes less over spray . I used it to paint a deck with heavy exterior paint worked like a charm . Also used it on a few interior walls and doors . Paint coverage is good and you would have to almost purposely try to get a run with it properly set up . I would definitely buy it again if this one ever fails . I do store mine with water in the tank to prevent any clogging and also spray water threw the machine after use until just clear water comes out .
customer_reviews.author: MULLER.C

customer_reviews.title: Great Finish Sprayer and Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: I've finished (urethane) all of my home's doors, cabinetry, and wood trim with this. It's the perfect DIY applicator. I could use my compressor instead, but use this because of the eventual buildup on the hose (In the case of urethane, etc. I don't want to get my compressor equipment all gunky). Over the past 10 years I've gone thru 3 of these, not because they broke, but because of this spray buildup in and on the unit (regardless of how well I thought I cleaned them). This is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: ORBroncoFan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed two coats of stain on my deck with this. Took a long time, but got a nice, thick coat on there both times. Superior to rolls and deck pads. We're talking somewhere in the neighborhood of 600 sq ft of deck, with another 600 or so feet in railings, support columns and vertical surfaces. Took a long time, needed to stop to clean it a couple times, got a little messy from time to time, but never broke down mechanically, just got plugged up with drying paint, and it powered through the massive job I had layed out for it. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Compressor stopped working after just two uses.
customer_reviews.text: While it was working, it was very easy to use and gave a wonderful even finish. However, it stopped working half-way through the first small job. We let it rest overnight, thinking maybe it overheated; although the unit did not feel hot. It started up fine the second day, but 30 minutes into spraying some very thin varnish, it gave up the ghost. Wagner has excellent customer service though and they are sending me a new unit! This is why they get a 3 instead of a two. I am hoping this was just a fluke. I will give my review of the new unit when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So I just sprayed a water based stain on my fence today and got my first feel of the Wagner Spraytech 0518080. Initial response is, I love it. It had minimal over spray on full pressure, even distribution, and easy cleanup. Using a water based stain, the cleanup was about 5-10 minutes at best. There are three spray patterns to choose from, all of them tight and evenly distributed. And what a huge time saver, painted 70 feet of fence in less than a half an hour. Would purchase again, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer exceeded my expectations! It is designed for smaller jobs, but I used it to apply Thompson’s Watersealer Plus Wood Preserver to my very large fence. It worked flawlessly...never clogged up or ran hot. The key to proper operation is pouring your product into the sprayer through a strainer. This collects any small bits or particles which keeps the sprayer from clogging up. I used a handheld flour strainer because the sealer just wouldn’t flow through the paint strainer I had bought. It worked fine. Follow the directions regarding how to use the sprayer. It’s easy, user friendly, and works as advertised. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gm5

customer_reviews.title: Great experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the primary reason of spraying bedroom furniture I built. The sprayer exceeded my expectation when spraying latex. I used Floetrol conditioner with a little water to thin the paint.
customer_reviews.author: JasonW

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at spraying for a long time. Owned a few, a couple of them were Wagners (inexpensive ones) and they were junk, so I was apprehensive about buying another but the reviews won me over. I have an airless sprayer I spent a lot of money on, but it is a real pain to clean. This Wagner, straight out of the box, with very little set-up is a dream. After a little practice on some cardboard, I painted two projects with a lot of nooks and crannies. All the nooks and crannies might have taken me 6-8 hours with a brush... but with this Wagner, 30 minutes and done! Results were stellar. Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: A substantial six foot high privacy fence was installed around my property. I was not going to consider tackling weather sealing the fence by a brush or roller, knowing it would take quite some time to complete the weather seal that way. This item stood out in comparison to other items when I did my research and read reviews. I must say I made the correct decision. I completed the weather seal so quickly and with ease I was pleasantly surprised. Cleanup was also an effortless breeze. "BUY THIS ITEM".
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer and great price
customer_reviews.text: The only downside to this is that the cup is small so you have to refill a lot. I struggled a little keeping the button even but my husband could easily keep the button held down all the way to spray stain our fence. We were able to do our fence very quickly. Paint brushes were taking days just for a few panels working for an hour or two at night. It’s easy to use but you’ll need an extension cord (the cord on this is very short so I wanted to note that for new DIYers). Highly recommend this sprayer for any staining you may need to do.
customer_reviews.author: A Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer does not stand behind product
customer_reviews.text: Wagner customer support is horrendous. I’ve owned 4 of these sprayers. I’ve had them cut off and never turn back on. I’ve had them loose suction and back up product into the air hose and out of the neck of the sprayer all over me. I called Wagner only to get someone who is condescending and telling me that my material was too thick. And, that I can send the sprayer in for them to test. What?!?!! You want to test a $100 sprayer? I even offered to send video of the sprayer not working. I will never purchased another Wagner product. This sprayer worked for a couple months, malfunctioned and the manufacturer does not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jermyn

customer_reviews.title: Plasti dip
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say I was impressed with this spray system.. Just perfect for spraying plasti dip...i was a worried it wouldn't spray dip right but.. was flawless
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally took this thing out of the box and put it to work. I’m preparing my home for sale and straight out of the box, loaded it up with paint, plugged it in, turned it on and starting shooting paint. It’s incredibly easy to use, makes paint last forever! ***User tip: make a pass and come right back over it to get perfect coverage if you’re spraying 4-6” away from surface. Best purchase I’ve ever made in relation to painting. People say it makes a mess inside but if you tape everything off you’ll be fine. HIGHLY recommend!!!! Easy peasy to clean also!! I’ll add photos later I was too excited painting to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Chuy

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT! Stained a 280 sqf deck TWICE in about ...
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT! Stained a 280 sqf deck TWICE in about 2 1/2 hours including all the railings. My only advice is to make sure you STRAIN your stain. This gums up if you have any clumps of stain in the spray. If I used a strainer from the dollar store I could have cut my time down by at least 30 minutes. Break down is simple and quick.
customer_reviews.author: WooHoo2You

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer
customer_reviews.text: It worked well and was easy to use. I don't have a lot of paint sprayer experience to compare it to but it's definitely much better than painting by hand! There were a couple times the paint sort of gurgled/bubbled up when I was unscrewing the container after I finished painting and that made clean up more annoying than usual, but I think this was likely because of user error. For the most part it's pretty easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love this!!! I bought to redone a dresser. I have never used one of these before and it was very self explanatory. I didn't even thin the latex wall paint I used for my project and it worked great. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This system saved me about $8,000 as I painted my kitchen cabinets in stead of replacing them. I love this sprayer as it was super easy to use and did a great job. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mary I. King

customer_reviews.title: Overall Performance not great
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this product several times and it is just not good enough. First, it does not work on Latex paint, which is not clearly stated when buying, and aside from that, when using it with the right viscosity and paint types it would only work well for thirty minutes and then get stuck to the point to where I had to clean it again. It is also bulky to carry around. I purchased another gun for half the price that worked extremely well compared to this. Would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mafe Holt

customer_reviews.title: Painting a house with this would be inconsistent and unnecessarily time consuming
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as I expected it to after reading past reviews and using other models of Wagner gun. This gun was purchased to spray stain and out door exterior paint. Outdoor exterior had to be cut down much more than the instructions the gun had or from Behr suggested in order to get it to the necessary consistency for the gun and it was still not a smooth pass through the gun. Painting a house with this would be inconsistent and unnecessarily time consuming. We are going to hold on to it and use it for stain.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H

customer_reviews.title: Not for big jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for restaining my deck and first-time paint on my newly built pergola. You are better off using a brush. Maybe it is because I used latex paint, but the gun could barely spray it. I had to move at a snail's pace just to get a somewhat decent first coat on. I would say this gun would be good for small jobs that do not require a lot of paint. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup is super easy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing unit, sprayed a dining table and chairs with chalk paint and water based urethane. Today I painted my front door and exterior trim with dinner high gloss latex paint and I am excited to use it to paint my house with it! (A project I have put off for a couple of years already) Cleanup is so easy! Just water, I empty the unused paint in it's original paint container, rinse can clean and rinse off the pickup nozzle and under can until all paint is gone then spray to cans full of water at Max pressure and continue to rotate head spraying in every direction
customer_reviews.author: Joe King

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work Applying Kiltz 2 Primer
customer_reviews.text: It does not work if utilizing Kilz primer. In fact, they told me on the phone that it was not designed for thicker latex primers such as Kiltz. Yes, you can try to thin the primer - but at what cost to your goal of applying a good primer coat. So I will retain it for non-latex jobs around the house, and purchase a unit that can spray Kilz. Not a negative review - just a "heads-up" to those of you who need a sprayer for latex paint priming of anything. If I had experience with these, I might have already known this.
customer_reviews.author: Harry L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and does not use alot of paint
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do my empty house it was way better than rolling and surprisingly used way less paint. I did my first coat in my 395 square feet living room and used less than a can of paint. When I did my second coat rolling just to compare I ended up using a can and half of paint. Doesn’t leave streaks like normal paint rollers if you do touch up strokes after your initial strokes. It also dry the paint quicker as well. And when the job is done it looks like you have done two coats
customer_reviews.author: Kmillz

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Was weary about this with some of the negative reviews but turns out this this is awesome! Does a really great job once you get the hang of it. We painted our living room with this and it has vaulted ceilings so it made our lives so much easier. The only thing that keeps it from 5 stars is it does get a little clumpy at the spray nozzle and you have to pick at it with a toothpick or something. But that's after constant use. Overall, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the negative latex reviews,.. I've sprayed high gloss, semi-gloss and satin latex with zero issues. Doors, walls, ceilings and trim. Deck stain and spray tan! This gun is versatile and can be adjusted to anything I've filled it with. Read the directions and learn to use the tool, clean every part after use. Saved countless hours and cash. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made painting the cabinets so so easy
customer_reviews.text: Used with latex enamel paint from sherwin william (Emerald enamel paint) No dilution required, used with max blower strength. No gunk, even spray. Used the fine spray head (sold separately)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: First time user of a spray painter and WOW. I haven't looked up adapters but even the large bottle was too small for me. I painted about 400 ft X 6 ft high of fencing. First coat took about 2 hours. Second coat was faster and took less paint. Other than watching for overspray and wind conditions, I was thrilled! A real time saver. Clean up was fast and simple too.
customer_reviews.author: J.P. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Works great and it still fast even if with more frequently refills.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I had gotten one that had a larger paint holder and used a tube to attach from the holder to the sprayer motor and I could not get either of the attached ends to not leak. Made a royal mess in 10 minutes. Then I got this one, and it was simple and no drips and easy to clean. Cordless would be nice but this was definitely manageable. I am a 65-year-old woman and I used the quart and a half container and sprayed with my right hand and back brushed the stain with my left hand. Right hand got a little tired but that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to get this unit to work with no success. The online reviews and videos were good but in actual use the results were very poor. This is an unusable item and unfortunately the return window closed four days ago so it will go in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: PJC

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sprayer to paint my kitchen cabinets. I did have to thin out the primer and the paint quite a bit, which I believe is the reason I had to spray on 3-4 coats, but the result looks so professional it was definitely worth the effort. I went from cherry stained to white and the kitchen looks amazing. You'd never know such a dark stain was ever on these cabinets looking at them now. They look like they came out the factory white, that's how good of a job this sprayer does! I'm am very satisfied with this purchase and plan to get a lot more use out of this!!
customer_reviews.author: kevtlas

customer_reviews.title: 1 star because 0 is not an option
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back... the sprayer... or shall I call it spitter did not like spraying latex paint. Although it was listed as able to spray it and says to thin the paint according to manuf, the manufacture does NOT recommend thinning. The amount of overspray as well was overwhelming. The coverage was not all that good either.. overall just not happy with this unit.... maybe I got spoiled using a Fuji.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.text: We own a home woodworking business and bought this so we could spray stains and paints out of one gun. It's a pain to clean, and after using it for a couple months only 15-20 times, it no longer sprays consistently. Half of the spray pattern sprays heavier than the other, so your finish is uneven. The replacement filters/parts are expensive and fairly hard to find, and the yellow plastic tab that keeps the nozzle/cup assembly from rotating during use broke off after about the third time we used it. This was our first and last Wagner.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This works great with stain
customer_reviews.text: This works great with stain. I followed the read the directions twice reviewers comments and had no problem. Definitely you have to use paint strainers, I added a couple of tablespoons of water to the Behr stain in a tank full of stain and it was good to go. I would definitely recommend this sprayer, very happy with purchase. And I was painting a big area, 6' x 24' through wire mesh in a livestock run in.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: Good spray gun for applying stain & sealant but needs a much larger bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday and put it to use this morning by applying Thompson's stain/waterseal to some new sections of a wood fence that we recently had installed. The gun works well. I give it four stars and the only reason why I didn't give it five stars was that the bowl is so small that I had to constantly refill it and this made the staining project take much longer than it should have. Wagner should make a much larger bowl or provide or sell an attachment where the user could run a suction tube directly into the gallon can of stain or something similar. Other than the low capacity, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: V.J.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one month
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed... I've had this paint sprayer for a little over a month and only used it 3 times so far. It worked amazing at first and I have been extremely diligent and obsessive about cleaning in between uses, but now the knob that controls the amount of paint flow came off and it is spattering and making a mess everywhere when I try to use it. No matter how I try you adjust it, it is spraying huge drops of paint instead of "spraying". I've watched a ton of YouTube videos trying to figure out the problem, but have yet to find a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer for exterior painting
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this sprayer to paint the exterior of our 2 story cedar shingle and clapboard home. My husbamd liked the length of the hose which came with this model. the unit was lightweight and also easy to clean after painting . We have completed half the house and it has done a great job! My 18 year old son actually did the spraying and foumd it very easy to control and use.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great for cabinets
customer_reviews.text: This wasn’t the best for interior walls. The spray seemed to be small in width. I am not faulting the sprayer in the event “control sprayer” is such. I mainly got it for my kitchen cabinets. I didn’t need to thin the latex paint. Only a few times it would spit some chunks, but I quickly took it apart and cleaned and it worked fine. I plan to paint some trim, table, and chairs withbit also. Pretty easy to clean when finished as well. Overall, I am happy with this purchase for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Fences if Hot Outside
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed a large Picket Fence with 25 Gallons of a high Quality Latex Stain. I followed all instructions on paint and sprayer. It worked well when the outside temperature was 80 degrees F or lower. When the outside temperature got up to 85 degrees all it did was constantly clog requiring a lot of effort. In July and August this makes the Sprayer pretty much useless for outdoor work. in OHIO.
customer_reviews.author: James W Barton

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device based on reviews. I previously had experience with a Graco product of very similar design.(The Graco painted two houses...and worked really well.). In short this gizmo would not spray...regardless of how much I thinned the paint. Regardless of pressure the paint volume was virtually nothing. I put the same paint in a Harbor Freight sprayer and had no further issues. Something was wrong with the spray gun that I just could not trouble shoot....I can only assume the sprayer was defective or damaged due to other high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Beetle

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY with the new results
customer_reviews.text: I had my cabinets painted and the painter did an awful job. Sanded them down, bought this sprayer and fixed them myself. SO HAPPY with the new results. We used milk paint (had to add distilled water to spray) and poly sealer and both worked great with this sprayer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole K

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't do it without this machine!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted to start my own furniture refurbishing business, the Wagner paint gun has made it a reality. I've used chalk paint, three parts paint to one part water, and every piece is a masterpiece. It's easy to use and clean up is a snap. I'm considering buying a second just for my poly finish. If you're on the fence, don't be, this machine is fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is awesome for the price. I sprayed and entire Pottery Barn bedroom set in one day with awesome results. Used Sherwin Williams Pro Classic thinned 10% with water. Waited until the next day and sprayed with Polycrilic without thinning. Came out fantastic. The gun is simple to clean literally only took 8 minutes. I cleaned the gun after each coat. Sprayed 2 coats of paint and 3 coats of Polycrilic.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G.

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I am an armature was able to use this sprayer without any problems. I used a latex exterior paint with paint conditioner to paint the lattice around my front porch. I used 1 1/2 gallons of paint (our porch is 9' off the ground on one end). The sprayer made this task doable in a few hours mostly because I had peeling paint which needed 2 coats. Pros: Easy to use, makes job easy, and not so heavy that it tired my arms out. Cons: The stem that goes into the paint cup is non-flexible making angles harder to paint when almost empty. Overall, I am well satisfied and have already used this for other projects with satisfactory results.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Real great product, it has become mo go to device ...
customer_reviews.text: Real great product, it has become mo go to device for painting and use. I cannot more highly recommend it. It easy it to use. The only thing is that you have to make sure you clean it and run water through it after every use or it will get badly blocked up and cannot be used any more. Hence use it for jobs that you know are ready to be done since you cannot stop using it for more than 15 minutes either or the paint can drop up and stop the spraying process.
customer_reviews.author: SecurityCamera Expert

customer_reviews.title: Great for fence sealing
customer_reviews.text: Knocked out a 100’ fence with transparent redwood stain in record tone. Was going to use a bug sprayer and I’m glad I spent the money on this instead. If your using it with oil-based stain, prob my only recommendation is make sure you have a breathing mask, cover nearby concrete and stuff with a tarp and no cars around since the vapors are pretty intense. Other than being properly prepared, there’s nothing else really required
customer_reviews.author: mark2203

customer_reviews.title: Great Paint/Stain Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I got new fence installed and decided to invest on a good paint sprayer. This one is really easy to use, control, and it doesn't have much learning curve as some other review suggested. It's also easy to clean. I'm really happy with it. Comparing to using a brush many years ago, this is a lot faster and does a lot better paint job.
customer_reviews.author: B. Liang

customer_reviews.title: Such an amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace another sprayer I ordered that just did not do the expected job. This did not disappoint!!! This is so easy to use and there literally is no dilution to do. I'm using it to repaint the outside of my house and it works like a charm. It applies evenly and decently. There isn't much overspray either. I am very happy because this makes the job fast and easy. Also, it's really lightweight even with the paint canister full.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: did not last 45 days.
customer_reviews.text: Update Review. Purchased it Sep, by October it no longer would spray. Do not recommend buying this product. ---original review below--- It gets the job done. Spray is pretty inconsistent, however, and this product's design makes it even more inconsistent if you need to angle it. I'd only recommend this sprayer for jobs where you can stay completely parallel to the ground. Also I have its "settings wheel" turned to allow the least amount of product beings sprayed as possible and it still goes though way too much spray for my jobs, causing me to use product faster then I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely HORRIBLE. Sprayed Killz and barely any came out. So ok I added water to dilute it. Still barely came out. Then I used super paint from sherwin William's. The paint was spitting. Air was consistent, but paint would spit. No leaks and everything was tight. Absolutely useless
customer_reviews.author: Scott Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great. Over about a month i have been going through my house painting all the trim white. I initially painted them with a brush, but became disappointed when i noticed all the wavy brushstrokes. The Wagner doesn't allow you to have those lines, blotches, or what have you. It does the job above my expectations. The one or two cons: the unit must be operated with paint with clumps. You thank yourself by taking the time and straining the paint. Second, paint spray can be tricky to hone in. You may have to do some touch up work afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: archie d.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is working as expected. Moderately decent spray pattern, a little bit of leaking if I don't tighten the reservoir enough, easy to clean. It atomizes the material too much, leaving a haze of inhalable nastiness: wear a mask! Compared to my high-end airless sprayer...this one is lightweight, super easy to set up, easy to clean, and does an okay job on less critical jobs. I've used it on stone and panelling and I'm satisfied. I would not use it on fine furniture.
customer_reviews.author: First Rspoder

customer_reviews.title: I had way too much fun with this and got a bit carried away
customer_reviews.text: I had way too much fun with this and got a bit carried away. Immediately painted a stairwell going upstairs, and then took it outside and painted my picket fence. Works great and is fun and easy to use once you get the hang of the spray pattern adjustment. Cleans up easily. I should have used a cardboard backing for the fence, as it left me with painted foliage for a couple of months!! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dogma

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a spray painter. It was easy to understand the instructions and operate the sprayer. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the "funnel" included to test the viscosity of the liquid to be sprayed didn't really work that well. I tested a water based stain and it hardly ran through the funnel. So I just added a little water, and tried it. It worked fine but it was just luck that I got it to an acceptable thickness. I'm spraying beach stairs so controlling the spray pattern isn't that important. It definitely makes this job much easier and faster. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: jack 24

customer_reviews.title: Works great on home jobs
customer_reviews.text: Painted an entire room of dark bookcases with primer and then white paint. Did an excellent job. It does produce lots of paint in the air so make sure the room is sealed or you are spraying in an area you don't mind paint particles. Cleanup is not difficult. Just takes some time to make sure everything is clean. An old toothbrush helps.
customer_reviews.author: David W Kleinfelt

customer_reviews.title: Compressor went out before 1st project completed
customer_reviews.text: New Product purchased May 2019. Used for the 1st time July 2020. I was painting 140' x 6' fence (front and back). Did 1st coat one day (worked like a dream). Started 2nd coat day 2 and got a quarter of the way through when the compressor kicked off. Cooled off the machine and tried plugging it up again on multiple outlets; with no success.
customer_reviews.author: FishFan

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!! Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! This sprayer is amazing. I was hesitant at first to purchase it but after staining 2 decks by hand I thought I would give it a shot. The last deck I had to stain is 56 by 16 and takes forever with a brush. I was able to complete 90% of it just working on it when I get off work in 2 days with this sprayer!!! Wish I would of had it for the other decks. Easy to clean and easy to use, just read directions and practice on something before you dive into it.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: What a great purchase! Was hesitatant about but after reading the reviews it's fantastic. I do have experience using paint sprayers and would recommend mixing in Flotrol for your paint. Was really impressed with this unit. Highly recommend even if you're a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: j walker

customer_reviews.title: not for latex paints
customer_reviews.text: does NOT spray latex paint such as primer. you have to thin it to a point where it's mostly water coming out of the nozzle just to get it to spray. piece of garbage and does not clearly state it won't work for latex. in fact in the manual it tells you how to clean up when using latex...
customer_reviews.author: new fan

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Unbeatable value and usefulness.
customer_reviews.text: Very hand to have around the house! I've painted shelves, cabinets and doors so far. I had to thin down primer, everything else did just fine. Follow the directions and do keep the nozzle clean - just wipe with a wet cloth every few minutes. I cover mine up with the same wet cloth while I swap out pieces that I'm painting.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: I previously owned a hvlp sprayer 20 years ago I used to repaint cabinets and liked it. I must admit I was more than ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to paint 2800 sq. ft. stucco house, and additional garage here in south Florida. I thinned Behr paint 10% and strained each fill up. I really didn't know for sure what to expect when I started this project, except I knew I did not want to try and roll it. I previously owned a hvlp sprayer 20 years ago I used to repaint cabinets and liked it. I must admit I was more than pleased with the results. No problems at all. Excellent coverage, fast, almost no overspray. Just make sure clean up everything when done for the day. I would consider this an excellent purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for this sprayer. the spray covers a very small area at a time, and can get a bit heavy to hold for any length of time. If using it for small hobby painting it would probably be ok. , but I had several cabinet doors and drawers to paint and found a brush and roller to be much faster. It didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: cookiecutter

customer_reviews.title: So so but wish I had saved up for a better system
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a few times and am not particularly impressed. I've never gotten it to lay down a good finish and it seems to use a lot of paint for some fairly small applications. I'll give it a few more chances and then likely sell it and save up for a much higher end system like a Fuji or an Apollo. I almost pulled the trigger on a Fuji system but I don't paint that often that I tried to save some money and start with a cheaper system. It looks like you get what you pay for and I kind of regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Does a Nice Job
customer_reviews.text: I spray painted a wood lattice fence, which sure beats painting it with a brush. Cleaning was straight forward after you figure out how to completely disassemble the sprayer. I used latex paint so plain water was sufficient to clean everything. I noticed the air filters do get clogged after extended usage and cannot be cleaned with water. My complaints are that the price for replacement filters was rather expensive and the gasket between the paint supply canister and spray gun is not listed on the manufacturer's WEB site for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a great value. I sprayed all the trim in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a great value. I sprayed all the trim in my house and it did a great job. The problem that other people have is that they are not thinning the paint enough or are using low quality paint. This works great with Sherwin Williams ProClassic Waterborne Alkyd.
customer_reviews.author: steviedt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the dubious task of hand staining my over 200 deck spindles so I decided to give this sprayer a shot based on previous reviews. This was my first time using a sprayer for such a large project but I was able to finish the job in about 2 hours. Not only did I save a bunch of time but I was able to get in all the corners and spots that are tough to get at with a brush. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Weak, unless you're painting really thin stains it belongs in the toy box
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly enough power to spray water based latex paints or primers. I spent nearly 2 hours priming (kilz2 latex) and painting (premium enamel latex) until I realized this thing is was way too weak to finish the job. The only reason that I'm giving it two stars and not one is that it actually got through one side of a door from start to finish. If I had to paint everything else with this sprayer I would be at it for a week. I'm pretty sure the motor would burn out by then anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Adashthechemist

customer_reviews.title: Great little sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It is a great sprayer but not for large jobs. I did my unfinished basement ceilings floor joists and it worked great but slow for the size of the job. It was better than spending $400 for a faster bigger sprayer. I have plenty of small jobs so it will be used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For a non-professional sprayer this one is pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mostly painting trim and doors. Overall I am very happy with the sprayer. Just be sure the paint isn't too thick or it will clog and cause irregular spray patterns. It cleans very easily. Someone else said to be sure to read the instructions a few times and be familiar with the pieces and I definitely agree with that. This saved us a ton of time and I am glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Keto Kween

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the good reviews...
customer_reviews.text: My mom wanted her walls painted and I thought it would be fun with a "new toy" to do it with. I couldn't get this thing to work AT ALL! I followed all of the directions of how to water down the paint, it still came out in streaks and with horrible coverage. I ended up giving up after half of one wall. I had to repaint that section using a roller when I was done. I would recommend either renting a better machine or buying a more expensive one that is more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Tosello

customer_reviews.title: I used latex paint and had to thin it a little more than recommended by the paint manufacturer in order to ensure very ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I have only used it for one project, prepping quarter round before installing, and it worked very well in coverage and saved me a lot of time. I used latex paint and had to thin it a little more than recommended by the paint manufacturer in order to ensure very fine particles and smooth coverage. Cleaning is a little bit of a pain, but that is expected when you are spraying paint through a small orifice.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot handle thicker paints, but follow the thinning instructions and be ready for several coats!
customer_reviews.text: The paint needed to be thinned to such a level where 1-2 coats was not even sufficient for my medium project of painting built-in bookshelves. I did not experience any of the clogging that some others have mentioned but that is likely because 1) I cleaned the spray tip frequently and 2) I actually thinned the paint until it flowed through the cup as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wright

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sprayer! Ok so thought this might be "cheap and not work", but I used this on some pretty thick Floor UV (Lowe's) cedar deck stain for a 300 foot plank fence. Cut my time in 1/2, spray was even and saved my back! Make sure you use this on "NEW STAIN", if it's old stain it will clog the gun...that information saved me a lot of time lol :)
customer_reviews.author: Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to reprint my kitchen cabinets. It did OK the first day of doing the upper boxes. On the second day the hose began to deteriorate, first where it connects to the sprayer and then later in the middle of the hose. Not happy about having to tape up a brand new hose I had only used for a few hours. Overall the quality of the spray was not to my liking, I was steady and meticulous and still globs of paint would spurt out. Ultimately I'm going to have to do some sanding and buy a different sprayer to finish the job right.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L Kelley

customer_reviews.title: I might recommend it, however the one I received was defective ...
customer_reviews.text: The gun I received was defective and completely broken. The HPLV guns have a seal in them and mine was defective so it leaked all over my driveway. I fully understand this isn't a "top of the line sprayer" but I at least expected it to hold the liquid in the hopper. Also the sprayer nozzle on the gun was broken and it had an incredibly uneven spray pattern. If this gun was in proper working order, I might recommend it, however the one I received was defective and I was forced to use it anyway since I absolutely needed to paint last weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Shea E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for staining fences, not much back splash
customer_reviews.text: I used this to stain 180 linear feat of 6' tall fence, and it made the job much easier. Still took four hours. I cleaned it thoroughly and it looks like new. I did get the strainers, the paper funnel strainers that probably show up on this page somewhere, and I recommend you do too, as there is little tolerance for lumps. I dressed for war, goggles, face mask, and got very little back splash on a slightly windy day.
customer_reviews.author: A. Longley

customer_reviews.title: It is easier to roll or brush
customer_reviews.text: Spraying a deck was my thought, and I waited for a stretch of nice weather, thus now I cannot return. But I found it a very slow process, and it was must faster to use a roller and brush. This did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little sprayer. Easy to fill. Easy to clean. Sprays evenly. Has an adjustable pattern with varied widths. I sprayed a porch with lots of pickets and it did a great job. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: jan sewell

customer_reviews.title: Time saver with great results.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to paint my kitchen cabinets. I pulled all the doors off and painted them in my garage. I put 1 coat of primer and 2 coats of paint. I have to say that it did a great job and talk about saving time. I didn't have any orange peel look and the finish came out like it was done by a professional in my opinion. Clean up was very easy as well. Yes there is a good amount of overspray though but I guess with a sprayer that is to be expected. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Aside from needing to constantly clean out the nozzle tip, sprayer worked pretty well at first for a bargain option. 2 months after I purchased it, doesn't work anymore. The plastic piece that pushes down under the nozzle cap won't seat properly. No way to force it. Skip this and find a better option.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for bakers! Making great chocolate velvet texture for my mousse cake.
customer_reviews.author: Yana K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Wagner 👏
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical with this purchase. Despite so many positive reviews, I wasn't confident that this product was for me. I was extremely surprised how well this DIY lil sprayer had worked, very pleased with this product 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Does What they as long as You keep it cleaned have used it for many project for well over 2 years
customer_reviews.author: EZFASTWEB

customer_reviews.title: Used this to spray my cabinets with Latex. Used ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to spray my cabinets with Latex. Used Sherwin Williams Pro Block Primer (10% Thinner) and 2 top coats of Sherwin Williams Pro Classic (10% Thinner, 5% Floetrol). Tip will start sputtering once in a while, so just keep a clean cloth really or something to wipe the tip every so often. All and all worth the money. Cabinets were sanded, wiped down, primered, and sprayed. Would use this for any project, really saved on labor and paint.
customer_reviews.author: NiceGuy

customer_reviews.title: Performs admirably
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer works as intended and leaves a fine finish. Works perfectly with stains; performs decently with latex based products. The key to with a latex base is to thin the overall solution with 10% distilled water, and spray in Multiple coats. Only con: spray area can be larger than expected. For the $100 tag, you won't get an exact factory finish, but it comes close. Test on scrap before attempting a project.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cypcar

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: Was Leary but it works pretty well. With proper mixture and adjustments it sprays well and overspray is not bad at all. Repainted 4 outdoor metal patio tables and 16 chairs and it did very well. It was a Rust Oleum water based made for outdoor metal. Fairly thick but used a bit of Flowtrol and minimal water and it sprayed just fine. Not sure how it will hold up compared to Oil Base but it was easier cleanup Clean up of gun is very easy. Hose Not so much but that is simply understandable. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: COLTON

customer_reviews.title: Uses minimal material and delivers a fine fog of stain like I have never seen
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned about prior experience with this type of product from years ago. The improvements are substantial and the quality of spray has been remarkable. Would buy this again in an instant. Fan-damn-tastic. Did a large amount of fence with little to zero overspray. Uses minimal material and delivers a fine fog of stain like I have never seen.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson S.

product_meta.title: Wagner Spraytech 0518080 Control Spray Max HVLP Paint or Stain Sprayer, Complete Adjustability for Decks, Cabinets, Furniture and Woodworking, Extra Container included
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Control Spray MaxThe Control Spray Max provides a smooth, consistent finish in less time than traditional painting methods. The controls give you the ability to adjust based on the project you’re working on and the type of material being used, which are features that a spray can or brush can’t offer! The spray patterns range from 1/2" to 12" wide depending on the settings, which allow for optimum control and precision for fine finish work. HVLP technology uses a high volume of air at low pressure to atomize materials into fine particles. This results in a professional finish, with virtually no overspray. Package includes a Control Max sprayer, 1 qt. metal cup, 1.5 qt. plastic cup, 20 ft. hose, viscosity cup and user manual.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Control Spray Max sprays materials in patterns from 1/2" to 12" wide with optimum control and precision making it superior to brushes and spray cans for fine finish work. HVLP technology uses a high volume of air at low pressure to atomize materials into fine particles. This results in a professional finish, with virtually no overspray.
feature_bullets: HVLP PAINT SPRAYER: The Control Spray Max paint sprayer uses high volume, low pressure technology to atomize materials into fine particles and provide a smooth finish
GREAT FOR ANY PROJECT: Perfect for priming, painting or staining cabinets, door trim, decks, furniture, woodworking projects and more
USE WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF MATERIALS: Powerful two-stage turbine makes it easy to paint walls and surfaces with latex paints and thinner materials like stains and poly

ADJUSTABLE SETTINGS: Customize your paint flow by using the pressure control dial and material flow adjuster to receive the perfect finish every time. Turn the air cap to spray round, horizontal, or vertical

GREAT DESIGN: The stationary base is connected to the spray gun with a 20 ft. hose to easily reach your painting project and reduce hand fatigue. Also includes a 1 ½ qt. cup and professional grade metal 1 qt. cup

specifications.Included Components: Sprayer, Metal Cup, Plastic Cup, User Manual., Hose
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,061 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
